snippet: John Gregg knows $1 million was too much to pay for a 78-year-old wooden fishing boat, but he’s spending an additional $2 million to refit it as a science and education vessel.
abstract: Western Flyer, sardine fishing boat made famous by John Steinbeck book The Log From the Sea of Cortez, is being restored by current owner John Gregg; says book inspired him to become scientist and that he wishes to restore boat so that it can serve as science and education vessel.
lead_paragraph: John Gregg knows $1 million was too much to pay for a 78-year-old wooden fishing boat, but he’s spending an additional $2 million to refit it as a science and education vessel.

headline.main: 75 Years After Steinbeck Sailed, a Boat Is Readied to Go Back to Sea
headline.print_headline: 75 Years After Steinbeck Sailed, a Boat Is Readied to Go Back to Sea
